intro: Krebsia striata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed false nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture and produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters. Krebsia striata is known for its ability to thrive in wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of wetland flora.
